name: Project Setup & Navigation Shell
goal: Establish the project foundation with Next.js and create the global navigation structure

tasks.description: Initialize Next.js project with TypeScript and App Router
steps: Run npx create-next-app with TypeScript template
Verify project structure uses App Router (app/ directory)

tasks.description: Configure project structure and create globals.css
steps: Create src/components/ directory for reusable components
Create src/app/globals.css with dark IDE theme
Define CSS variables for colors, spacing, transitions

tasks.description: Create Navigation component with 8 view icons
steps: Configure navigation items with href, icon, and label
Implement usePathname() for active state detection
Add tooltip support with data-tooltip attribute
Style active states with blue accent border

tasks.description: Create global layout with persistent navigation toolbar
steps: Create src/app/layout.tsx with root layout structure
Set up flexbox layout with fixed sidebar
Configure main content area with proper margin
Verify navigation persists across all routes

tasks.description: Create placeholder page components for each view
Navigation routing works for all views
steps: Verify all 8 icons link to correct routes
Test navigation by clicking each icon

tasks.description: Active navigation item is visually highlighted
steps: Implement active state detection using usePathname()
Apply .active class when pathname matches href
Verify blue left border appears on active item
Check lighter background on active item
Confirm only one icon is highlighted at a time

tasks.description: Layout maintains structure across all views
steps: Verify toolbar is fixed position (left: 0, top: 0)
Check main content area fills remaining space
Test responsive behavior at different screen sizes
Confirm consistent icon sizing and spacing
Verify dark background colors throughout UI
Check navigation toolbar has subtle contrast
Verify hover states provide clear feedback
